alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Cherokee; Cleburne; Etowah (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 1:00PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Calhoun, southeastern Etowah, northeastern Cleburne and Cherokee Counties through 145 PM CST... At 100 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cornwall Furnace Park to near Neely Henry Lake. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jacksonville, Piedmont, Hokes Bluff, Centre, Cedar Bluff, Forney, Centre Municipal Airport, Glencoe, Ohatchee, Gaylesville, Tennala, Pleasant Gap, Cornwall Furnace Park, Eastern Weiss Lake, Jacksonville State University, Ballplay, Western Weiss Lake, Mars Hills, Moshat and Ball Flat. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
